item.title: BF3 alpha
item.dc:creator: Daishi
item.description:
Siggs:

Also, why make the sniper mechanic so realistic when the rest of the game isn’t in relation.

…

Actually screw that these days glare is rarely a problem. It’s called cowlings and treated lenses

Sniper mechanics are important because snipers alone have the capability to totally ruin a game since everyone hates them or loves them. The mechanics introduced try to level the playing field both directions so that there’s a happy medium between the lovers and haters.

Glare these days isn’t a problem at all. Take a look at the marine corps’ RCO. That 25-cent piece of plastic with cardboard honeycomb completely eliminates glare off the scope unless the light source is within 7 degrees of the center of the scope’s fov.

item.title: BF3 alpha
item.dc:creator: Surplus
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

That’s dumb, why would they do that?

It won’t effect me much anyway if it stays in, I suck at sniping.

To enforce actual sniping behavior. IE shoot change positions shoot change positions. Snipers that just sit camped on a hill get annoying. Both to be on the team and to fight.

Also they removed kill cam as far as I can tell so without it camping as sniper would be too effective.

It also isn’t all bad because it makes trying to head shot a sniper with the bright ass glare near impossible.

Furthermore I imagine you could avoid this glare as sniper by using a rifle without a scope. Just like a lot of the greatest snipers WWII did. (They were actually worried about the extra inch of exposure and glare from the scope too )
